function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited contact with nature during childhood due to urban upbringing and current urban living situation.","Impact":"Reduced exposure to natural environments may lead to compromised immune systems and increased susceptibility to contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Encouraging and facilitating regular access to green areas and natural environments for both children and adults.","Technologies":"Green space planning and development, urban park design, and community garden initiatives.","People":"Respondents, especially those raised and currently living in urban areas.","Owner":"Local government, city planners, community organizations."},{"Description":"Trend of increasing urban population and shift towards apartment living with less outdoor space.","Impact":"Higher population density and reduced access to outdoor spaces may contribute to the rapid spread of contagious diseases within urban environments.","Mitigation":"Implementing green infrastructure in urban areas, promoting rooftop gardens, and creating communal outdoor spaces in residential areas.","Technologies":"Green building design, vertical gardening systems, and urban planning for sustainable green spaces.","People":"City dwellers and residents of apartment buildings.","Owner":"City planners, real estate developers, and community associations."},{"Description":"Majority of respondents living in properties with 2-4 bedrooms, with a significant percentage being property owners.","Impact":"Stable housing situation may lead to complacency and reduced awareness of public health risks within the community.","Mitigation":"Promoting community health initiatives, conducting public health awareness campaigns, and fostering a culture of collective responsibility for disease prevention.","Technologies":"Health education programs, community health monitoring systems, and digital outreach platforms for public health communication.","People":"Property owners, stable residents in 2-4 bedroom dwellings.","Owner":"Health organizations, local government, and community leaders."}]}
